text:
e="preserve">William "Bucky" Baxter (1955May 25, 2020) was an American rock country guitarist. He was known for having played in Bob Dylan's Never Ending Tour during the 1990s. He released his only solo album, "Most Likely, No Problem", in 1999. He was born in Melbourne, Florida. Baxter was a founding member of The Dukes, Earle's backing band.
Baxter also appeared on various albums by artists such as Ryan Adams, R.E.M., and Joe Henry. In studio, Baxter played steel guitar, acoustic guitar, electric guitar, mandolin, dobro.
Baxter died on May 25, 2020, in Sanibel Island, Florida, at the age of 65.
